resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on issue #3281: ARROW-4127: [Documentation][Python] Add instructions to build with Docker
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3281#issuecomment-450697544
 
 
   @cav71 it is preferable to have a single PR for each change (this is the 3rd PR for this one), and if you need to make changes that you either force-push the branch (which automatically updates the PR) or push new commits. This helps the maintainers stay organized. If you need help with git workflows please don't hesitate to ask

cav71 commented on issue #3281: ARROW-4127: [Documentation][Python] Add instructions to build with Docker
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3281#issuecomment-451440312
 
 
   Hi @wesm,
   
   I've updated building.rst with docker instructions and the development.rst so point to the building.rst so we won't have duplicate documents.
   
   I've rebased to master, but for some reason the PR seems catching also changes from upstream/master. The git diff --name-only upstream/master..origin/documentation shows only building.rst and development.rst as changes (as it should be): does the github computes the difference from master at branch creation? I'm baffled here.
   
   Thanks
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3281: ARROW-4127: [Documentation][Python] Add instructions to build with Docker
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3281#issuecomment-451521909
 
 
   > I've rebased to master, but for some reason the PR seems catching also changes from upstream/master
   
   It looks like you have a mix of rebases and merges in this branch, which is going to cause issues. I'd recommend never using `git merge` for this project unless you are doing `git merge -ff-only`

wesm commented on issue #3281: ARROW-4127: [Documentation][Python] Add instructions to build with Docker
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3281#issuecomment-451521909
 
 
   > I've rebased to master, but for some reason the PR seems catching also changes from upstream/master
   
   It looks like you have a mix of rebases and merges in this branch, which can cause issue depending on what the state of various remotes is. I'd recommend never using `git merge` for this project unless you are doing `git merge -ff-only`
